content.html:
I got access to the Bluesky private beta (thanks Ryan!) and have been kicking the iOS app‚Äôs tyres. The app experience is basic but familiar. You can clearly see its Twitter roots. I was also pleased to be able to follow Aaron‚Äôs guide to using my personal domain as my handle.
The AT Protocol is also nicely designed. The federated social network world is certainly heating up.

I‚Äôd love to swap my Echo devices for HomePods, especially the new full-size ones, for privacy and HomeKit ecosystem reasons, but they‚Äôre not quite there for me. I can live with Siri being inferior to Alexa or Google Assistant for searches, but I need these:

BBC radio apps (or native support) so I can say ‚ÄúPlay Radio 4‚Äù or ‚ÄúPlay 6 Music‚Äù. This is probably 80% of my use of the Echo in the kitchen.
Full Spotify Connect so I can resume or control playback from my laptop or phone. AirPlaying audio...
